caption.p: Phenotypic nodes and predicted responses from simulations with in silico perturbations

tr.th: Immediate upstream nodes (<wij> in average model)

tr.td: Cell cycle (cyclin B1, RBpS807, cyclin D1, PLK1), MAPK pathway (MAPKpT202, MEKpS217, BRAF, aBRAF), AKT, AKTpT308, RAD51, p38/MAPK14, aSRC, YBIpS102, cJUNpS73, SMAD3
aPKC, SMAD3pS423, STAT3pS705, IGFBP2, cyclin B1, IGF1Rβ, Fibronectin

fn.p: A proteomic node is a primary target when substantial phenotypic change is predicted in response to perturbation of the node alone. The phenotypic response is further increased when the primary targets are perturbed in combination with a set of other nodes (i.e., the combination partners). Also See Figure 5D–H, Supplementary file 1D and Figure 5—figure supplements 1, 2.
